question: Which of the following is an example of a general descendant selector?
Which one of the following CSS functions allows you to change the shape of an element by warping its points by the specified angle in each direction?
Which selector is used to find anchor elements that have not been visited by the user?
Which attribute allows you to use a media query on a <link> element to conditionally load an external stylesheet?
The vertical-align property sets the vertical alignment for which of the following?

What is the result of the CSS rules below?

.container p {

  float: left!important;

}

<div class="container">

  <p>This is a paragraph.</p>

  <p>This is another paragraph.</p>

</div>
correct_answer: The <div class="container"> default height value will be 0 as all child elements are floated.
incorrect_answers: The children elements float attribute value is also left.
The overflow attribute value of <div class="container"> is "auto" by default.
The <div class="container"> margin attribute value is ignored.

question: Which statement is true regarding the animation of SVG elements with CSS?
correct_answer: They can be animated with the same CSS properties as HTML elements.
incorrect_answers: CSS property animations for SVG only work in the Chrome Web Browser
It is not possible to animate SVG elements with CSS.
SVG elements have a special set of CSS animation properties.

question:
Based on the structure below, which selector type will target only <p> elements that immediately follow after a given <div> element?

<body>

  <div>

    <p>Example paragraph.</p>

  </div>

  <p>Which selector will target only this paragraph?</p>

</body>

Based on the following CSS and HTML, what will be the final color value of the <li> elements?

<style>

  .list li { color: red; }

  div ul li { color: blue; }

  li { color: green; }

</style>

<div class="list">

  <ul>

    <li>Item 1</li>

    <li>Item 2</li>

    <li>Item 3</li>

  </ul>

</div>

If the following selectors are being applied to the same element, what will be the final color of the element?

.element {

  color: red;

}

div[id="container"] h1 {

  color: blue;

}

.main div:nth-of-type(2) h1 {

  color: green;

}
Which of the following properties has a default value of ease and specifies how the speed during a transition will be calculated?
Which value of the display property will change the layout behavior of an element to act like a block element in the flexbox model?

What will be the final color value of the span below?

<div>

  <p>This is a <span>paragraph</span>.</p>

</div>

div span {

  color: blue;

}

p span {

  color: green;

}

span {

  color: red;

}
Which of the following is true of an element that precedes a floated element?
correct_answer: The element will not be affected by the floated element.
incorrect_answers: The element will float to the left of the next element in document flow.
The element will float to the right of the next element in document flow.
The element will flow around the following element.

question:
Which of the following best describes the result of the Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) rule below?

.element {

  left: 20px;

  top: 50px;

  z-index: 3;

}

<div class="element">Some text</div>
correct_answer: None of the declarations will have an effect unless a position property is set to anything other than static or sticky.
incorrect_answers: The element will have a z-index of 3 but top and left properties will be ignored.
The element will be offset 20 pixels to the left and 50 pixels from the top of the browser window, with a stacking order of 3 on the z axis.
The element will be offset by its original position left by 20 pixels and 50px from the top, and the z-index value will be ignored.

question:
What is the effect of using a negative number in a padding declaration? Example:

p {

  padding-top: -10px;

}
What is a valid value for the font-stretch attribute?
Which list-style-type property renders a filled circle?
Which of the following properties allows you to use a customized cursor?

On which side will there be a 30px padding given the following declaration?

padding: 10px 15px 20px 30px;

Which of the following would be the result of the rule below?

tr:nth-child(2n){

  background-color: red;

}
correct_answer: Changes the background color of every even table row to red
incorrect_answers: Changes the text color of ONLY the second row in a table to red
Changes the text color of every even number table row to red
Changes the background color of ONLY the second row in a table to red

question: What does the background-attachment property do?
correct_answer: It sets whether a background image should scroll with the content, or be fixed.
incorrect_answers: It displays a link to the background.
It links background as an external file.
It attaches an image to the background.

question: Which of the following styles has the lowest specificity?
Which of the following keywords can be used to force property inheritance on an element?
Which of the following is a valid pseudo-element?

Which element will be matched by the following CSS selector?

div[class^="foo"]
What is the default value of the float property?
Which of the following will redefine the default margin and padding settings for all browsers so that they are identical?
incorrect_answers: Setting margin and padding to auto
Setting margin and padding to inherit
Setting margin and padding to custom

question: With regards to the cascade effect of CSS, when does the order of the rules take precedence?
correct_answer: The order matters when the elements possess equal specificity.
incorrect_answers: The order matters only when !important is NOT used.
The order only matters when using external style sheets.
The order has no effect on styles.

question: What is the transform: translate() method used for?
correct_answer: To offset elements from their current position
incorrect_answers: To translate text to the language given as a parameter
To use non-euclidean geometry on elements
To skew an element's bounding box

question: Which of the following declarations could be used to hide an image without affecting the document's layout?
Which of the following best describes the role of the float property?
correct_answer: To change the default behavior of an element in normal document flow relative to its containing block
incorrect_answers: To alter the default behavior and type of an element's rendering box
To position an element relative to its original position by the specified offsets
To change the layout model used by an element

question: Which is a layout model that demonstrates the relationship between parts in an element's rendering box (e.g. margins, padding, borders)?
